verses.verse: A Psalm of David<WH1732>. Blessed<WH1288> be the LORD<WH3068> my strength<WH6697>, which teacheth<WH3925> my hands<WH3027> to war<WH7128>, and my fingers<WH676> to fight<WH4421>: strength: Heb. rock to war: Heb. to the war, etc

My goodness<WH2617>, and my fortress<WH4686>; my high tower<WH4869>, and my deliverer<WH6403>; my shield<WH4043>, and he in whom I trust<WH2620>; who subdueth<WH7286> my people<WH5971> under me. My goodness: or, My mercy
LORD<WH3068>, what is man<WH120>, that thou takest knowledge<WH3045> of him! or the son<WH1121> of man<WH582>, that thou makest account<WH2803> of him!
Man<WH120> is like<WH1819> to vanity<WH1892>: his days<WH3117> are as a shadow<WH6738> that passeth away<WH5674>.
Bow<WH5186> thy heavens<WH8064>, O LORD<WH3068>, and come down<WH3381>: touch<WH5060> the mountains<WH2022>, and they shall smoke<WH6225>.
Cast forth<WH1299> lightning<WH1300>, and scatter<WH6327> them: shoot out<WH7971> thine arrows<WH2671>, and destroy<WH2000> them.

Send<WH7971> thine hand<WH3027> from above<WH4791>; rid<WH6475> me, and deliver<WH5337> me out of great<WH7227> waters<WH4325>, from the hand<WH3027> of strange<WH5236> children<WH1121>; hand from: Heb. hands from
Whose mouth<WH6310> speaketh<WH1696> vanity<WH7723>, and their right hand<WH3225> is a right hand<WH3225> of falsehood<WH8267>.
I will sing<WH7891> a new<WH2319> song<WH7892> unto thee, O God<WH430>: upon a psaltery<WH5035> and an instrument of ten strings<WH6218> will I sing praises<WH2167> unto thee.
It is he that giveth<WH5414> salvation<WH8668> unto kings<WH4428>: who delivereth<WH6475> David<WH1732> his servant<WH5650> from the hurtful<WH7451> sword<WH2719>. salvation: or, victory

Rid<WH6475> me, and deliver<WH5337> me from the hand<WH3027> of strange<WH5236> children<WH1121>, whose mouth<WH6310> speaketh<WH1696> vanity<WH7723>, and their right hand<WH3225> is a right hand<WH3225> of falsehood<WH8267>:

That our sons<WH1121> may be as plants<WH5195> grown up<WH1431> in their youth<WH5271>; that our daughters<WH1323> may be as corner stones<WH2106>, polished<WH2404> after the similitude<WH8403> of a palace<WH1964>: polished: Heb. cut

That our garners<WH4200> may be full<WH4392>, affording<WH6329> all manner of store<WH2177> <WH2177>: that our sheep<WH6629> may bring forth thousands<WH503> and ten thousands<WH7231> in our streets<WH2351>: all: Heb. from kind to kind

That our oxen<WH441> may be strong to labour<WH5445>; that there be no breaking in<WH6556>, nor going out<WH3318>; that there be no complaining<WH6682> in our streets<WH7339>. strong: Heb. able to bear burdens, or, loaden with flesh
Happy<WH835> is that people<WH5971>, that is in such a case<WH3602>: yea, happy<WH835> is that people<WH5971>, whose God<WH430> is the LORD<WH3068>.
